Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant obtain a stay of removal based on the PRRA decision and potential irreparable harm?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa; PRRA decision considered human rights abuses in Sri Lanka; family separation claimed as harm.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Applicant failed to meet the tripartite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Refusal of refugee claim and PRRA application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged risk upon return to Sri Lanka and family ties in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tripartite test: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Reasonableness of PRRA decision, deference to administrative decision-maker
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to PRRA and removal orders
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of PRRA decision with request for stay
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; PRRA officer found no sufficient risk
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Country condition reports, personal submissions on risk and family ties
Crimes.Application_Basis: Risk on return to Sri Lanka and humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: PRRA officer considered evidence of human rights abuses
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal to remain in Canada
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Toth tripartite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate unreasonableness of PRRA decision
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation not deemed irreparable harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refusal of refugee claim and negative PRRA decision led to scheduled removal
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer reviewed submitted evidence and found it insufficient
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on unauthorized stay after visa expiry
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural unfairness or evidentiary breach identified
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicant not in compliance due to overstaying
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over PRRA judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: PRRA decision upheld as reasonable based on record
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: PRRA decision not unreasonable; no irreparable harm shown
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) / IRCC PRRA Officer
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant did not show new compelling evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to PRRA decision

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant obtain a stay of removal based on irreparable harm from family separation?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claims irreparable harm due to separation from family in Canada; will reunite with family in Sri Lanka.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal to avoid family separation
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Family separation not considered irreparable harm in immigration context
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement of removal order after failed claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian grounds based on family ties in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Toth test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of family ties and feasibility of reunion abroad
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for stay during judicial review of PRRA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; focus on legal test for stay
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits on family relationships and emotional impact
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian concerns arising from enforced family separation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Acknowledged but not sufficient to establish irreparable harm
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Interim stay to prevent deportation and family separation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof that separation is irreparable or exceptional
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Separation not irreparable as family exists in country of return
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refusal of refugee claim, negative PRRA, pending removal
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Considered but outweighed by immigration enforcement interests
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly; consequence of lawful removal
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to failed status claims
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court's authority to grant stays
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Family ties acknowledged but not determinative
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Family separation inherent in removal; not irreparable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No new evidence undermining PRRA decision

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can Ms. Tharumarasah obtain a stay of removal while her H&C application is pending?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant has pending H&C application; seeks to remain during processing; PRRA already refused.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending H&C assessment
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Pending H&C does not automatically warrant a stay
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, negative PRRA, H&C application outstanding
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Proceeding with removal despite pending H&C
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations including integration and family
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Toth tripartite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Balance between administrative delay and enforcement interest
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Seeking interim relief during H&C processing
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Submissions on hardship, family, community ties
Crimes.Application_Basis: Equity, family unity, best interests of children
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: PRRA decision found no risk; H&C not yet decided
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal until H&C determination
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No showing that PRRA was unreasonable
Crimes.Cause_Description: Seeking to prevent removal pending H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: H&C not yet assessed; PRRA findings relied upon
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Court cannot stay removal solely due to pending H&C
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: H&C factors not yet evaluated administratively
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Stay requires meeting Toth test; applicant failed to do so
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: IRCC Case Processing Centre, PRRA Officer

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant is entitled to a stay of removal pending judicial review of the PRRA decision
Crimes.Application_Facts: Refugee claim previously denied; PRRA also refused; removal scheduled.
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No stay granted as tripartite test not satisfied
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement of removal after final decisions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk on return, family separation, procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tripartite test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Finality of administrative decisions, enforcement priority
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of judicial review and interim relief
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: PRRA officer assessed credibility and found no basis for fear
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Country reports, personal narrative, documentation of past events
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of persecution or risk upon return to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: PRRA officer reviewed and weighed all evidence
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal pending court challenge
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, PRRA Officer
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation not irreparable; risk not established
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on unauthorized presence post-refusal
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue raised; balance favors Minister

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant obtain a stay of removal based on challenge to PRRA decision?
Crimes.Application_Facts: PRRA conducted and refused; applicant claims risk in Sri Lanka; removal imminent.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay pending H&C assessment and judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: PRRA decision reasonable; no irreparable harm shown
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Proceeding with removal after PRRA refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of torture or persecution in Sri Lanka, family separation
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Weight given to PRRA officer’s assessment of country conditions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of PRRA with concurrent stay motion
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: PRRA officer assessed credibility and found no subjective fear
Crimes.Application_Basis: Personal risk due to past involvement and political situation in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: PRRA officer considered evidence and found risk not credible
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to present new evidence or show unreasonableness
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation not irreparable; risk not substantiated
Crimes.Cause_Description: PRRA refused due to lack of perceived risk in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None; removal lawful after PRRA refusal
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Out of status after final decisions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Court lacks authority to override PRRA without legal error
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No legal error in PRRA; balance of convenience favors state
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No fresh evidence submitted to court
